intro: Elaeoselinum mangenotianum, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, spreading habit with hairy leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. Elaeoselinum mangenotianum is also known for its resilience to coastal conditions and salt spray.
